content:
• Tuesday, February 21, 2017
  • NEM

    Newmont Mining sees higher 2017-18 gold costs; maintains production view

    • Newmont Mining (NYSE:NEM) -2.1% AH after missing its Q4 earnings estimate, as revenues rose 23% Y/Y but costs and expenses jumped 51% to $2.58B.
    • NEM says its Q4 all-in sustaining costs fell to $918/oz. from $1,036/oz. in the year-ago quarter but forecasts higher costs in 2017-18, with AISC expected at $940-$1,000/oz. in 2017 and $950-$1,050/oz. in 2018 en route to improved longer-term AISC of $880-$980/oz. on higher production from Ahafo and Long Canyon; but in the meantime, NEM forecasts investments to explore and develop expansions, to address geotechnical issues at Carlin and changes to cost allocation between gold and copper raising its gold cost outlook.
    • NEM says Q4 gold production rose 17% Y/Y to 1.3M oz. and FY 2016 gold output increased 7% to 4.9M oz., and maintains its view for 4.9M-5.4M oz. of FY 2017 attributable gold production and 4.5M-5.4M oz. for the next five years.
    • NEM also reports year-end 2016 gold reserves of 68.5M oz. vs. 71.1M in 2015. and sees FY 2017 total capex of $800M-$900M.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • SREV

    ServiceSource -26%; Q4 2016, outlook off

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $68.7M (+5.6% Y/Y, $1.33M below estimates), EPS $0.02 ($0.01 below estimates)
    • Q1 2017 projections – revenue $55M-$58M (consensus $63.76M), EPS -$0.04 to -$0.02 (consensus $0.01), gross margin 31%-34%, operating expense 40%, adjusted EBITDA -$4M to -$1M, net income -$3.5M to -$1.5M, free cash flow -$7M to -$4M
    • FY 2017 projections – revenue $248M-$258M (consensus $270.23M), EPS $0.02-$0.06 (consensus $0.09), gross margin 38%-40%, operating expense 37%-38%, adjusted EBITDA $11M-$15M, net income $2M-$5M, free cash flow -$12M to -$8M
    • ServiceSource (NASDAQ:SREV) $4.50.
    • Presentation slides
    • Conference call
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM | 1 Comment

  • FUEL

    Rocket Fuel -9.8% in late trade as Q1 guidance disappoints

    • Rocket Fuel (FUEL +3.2%) has sunk 9.8% in after-hours trade after a Q4 earnings report where it posted a smaller loss than expected but posted disappointing guidance for Q1.
    • Revenues and EBITDA were strong compared to guidance, and revenue beat analyst consensus despite falling 18% (non-GAAP basis; revenue was down fractionally on a GAAP basis).
    • But the company expects "typical seasonality" for Q1 and is guiding to non-GAAP net revenue of $47M-$52M (well below expectations for $106.6M) and EBITDA of -$7M to -$2M (vs. expected $1.7M).
    • Revenue from its top 50 customers made up 59% of total vs. a year-ago 46%; revenue from the top 250 customers made up 87% of total, compared to a year-ago 79%.
    • In Q4, free cash flow came in at $7.3M vs. a year-ago $1.8M.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM

    Tesoro Logistics to launch 5M-unit offering

  • NVDQ

    Cigna to cover Dermacell dermal matrix; exclusive distributor Novadaq up 9% after hours

    • Novadaq Technologies (NASDAQ:NVDQ) perks up 9% after hours on light volume in response to the news that Cigna (NYSE:CI) will cover Dermacell, a cellular dermal matrix, for use in breast reconstruction surgery and for the treatment of diabetic foot ulcers.
    • Dermacell was developed by LifeNet Health and is exclusively distributed by Novadaq Technologies (NVDQ).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • TRCO

    Tribune Media +2.2% as Starboard boosts stake to 6.6%

    • A filing disclosing an increased stake by Starboard Value has lifted Tribune Media (TRCO +2.2%) another 2.5% in extended trading, though on light volume.
    • The 13D filing shows Starboard has raised its stake to 6.6%, from a previous 2.3%.
    • Shares in Tribune Media are down 3.7% in 2017, but have pickd up 16.7% since Jan. 20.

    • Moody is currently senior VP and corporate secretary. She had joined the company in 2006 as senior litigation counsel.
    • She was promoted to VP of law in 2012, and deputy general counsel in 2013.

    Finisar +4.44%; Piper Jaffray reiterates at Overweight

    • Expecting Finisar's Q3 2017 (scheduled for March 9) and Q4 outlook to post above estimates, analyst Troy Jensen notes industry checks indicating strong demand, module disqualification concerns considered false or exaggerated, and the company's positive consumer 3D sensing prospects.

  • TOT

    Total is new Conviction Buy among big European oils at Goldman

    • Total (TOT +2.6%) is added to the Conviction Buy List at Goldman Sachs, which says TOT offers strong cash flow generation, an attractive portfolio of new investment opportunities , and higher growth thanks to startups coming online this year and next.
    • TOT, Eni (NYSE:E) and Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A, RDS.B) are the firm's Buy-rated names among the European oil giants - although Shell is no longer part of Goldman’s Conviction Buy list - with stable balance sheets, cost discipline, and project cycle timing among catalysts that should propel the stocks; the firm rates Statoil (STO) as a Sell.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 7 Comments
  • FNMA

    Frannie story isn't over - BofA

    • While today's appeals court ruling most likely means Fannie Mae (OTCQB:FNMA -29.2%) and Freddie Mac (OTCQB:FMCC -31.3%) shareholders aren't going to get satisfaction in the court system, there's still Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and his desire for changes at the GSEs, says Bank of America's Ralph Axel.
    • It's unclear what Mnuchin means when he says that, but it's possible he's talking about the net worth sweep.
    • The timeline for Mnuchin dealing with this is unclear, but Axel suspects sooner rather than later.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: Frannie now down nearly 40% following court decision (Feb. 21)
    • Previously: Fannie, Freddie profit sweep affirmed in appeal (Feb. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 139 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing strives toward quicker build for satellites, with fewer workers

    • Boeing (BA +1.7%) is taking steps to build satellites more quickly through new production practices that will rely more on 3-D printing and involve fewer workers, which eventually could transform its traditional way of turning out high-end commercial and military spacecraft, according to Paul Rusnock, who leads the company’s satellite business.
    • Rusnock tells WSJ that the benefits of the new manufacturing processes will be lower acquisition costs for operators while provide them greater opportunities to launch upgraded technology before hardware becomes outdated in orbit.
    • Boeing is adopting the concepts for various models and is actively looking to begin implementing them on selected commercial projects, and changes could accelerate if it succeeds in winning bids on various projects expected to be announced in coming months, Rusnock says, declining to identify any prospective customers.
    • “We cannot continue to do what we’ve been doing and stay competitive,” according to Rusnock.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • TVPT

    Post-earnings slide for Travelport

    • Travelport (TVPT -7.1%) is down sharply after falling short with Q4 revenue.
    • Revenue from technology services fell 13% Y/Y.
    • Increased costs tied to acquisitions and technology investments led to lower operating income during the quarter.
    • Previously: Travelport beats by $0.03, misses on revenue (Feb. 21)

  • CYH

    Community Healthcare rally stokes buying in related firms

    • Investors are spreading their good cheer with Community Healthcare Systems (CYH +34.8%) to others in the space.
    • Brookdale Senior Living (BKD +5.3%) is rumored to be an acquisition target, possibly by Ventas. Kindred Healthcare (KND +6.6%) and Tenet Healthcare (THC +7.4%) are due to report Q4 results next Monday, February 27.
    • Quorum Health (QHC +4.8%) should be reporting any time.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • CYH

    Barclays still neutral on Community Health, sees 2017 guidance as attainable; shares up 34%

    • Community Health Systems' (CYH +34.3%) Q4 beat is a positive and could signal an end to its deteriorating financials says Barclays in a note to investors. Q4 results imply a run rate that makes 2017 guidance achievable.
    • Volumes still negative but close to estimates. EBITDA consensus beat was first since Q2 2015.
    • EPS guidance range of $0.30 - 1.10 (midpoint = 0.70) is above $0.61 consensus view. Revenues of $15.8B - 16.2B implies 3% growth considering lost revenue of $2B from divestitures.
    • High level of debt (~$15B) remains a significant issue, represents 95% of enterprise value.
    • Neutral rating with $7 (24% downside risk) price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • SBLK

    Star Bulk Carriers upped to Buy at Deutsche Bank on dry bulk market view

    • Star Bulk Carriers (SBLK +14.5%) shoots higher after Deutsche Bank upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with a $12 price target, lifted from $3.50, with a "blue sky" valuation of $22 at Deutsche Bank, citing increased confidence in the dry bulk market recovery and the company's significant leverage to changes in market fundamentals given its huge 73-ship fleet.
    • Asset values also seem to be improving, the firm says, as its industry checks indicate “significantly more bids in the market for modern, second-hand dry bulk tonnage, and we expect to see more evidence of this as the year progresses."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM

  • HLX

    Helix Energy +14% following upbeat Q4, Stephens upgrade

    • Helix Energy (HLX +14.7%) after reporting a $0.05/share loss on a non-GAAP basis, less than the $0.08 loss analysts had expected (GAAP losses were $0.46), while revenue of $128M was roughly in-line with estimates.
    • Shares are higher despite issuing downside guidance for full-year revenues of ~$575M vs. $610M analyst consensus estimate, as well as EBITDA of $120M-$140M and capex of $200M.
    • Stephens analysts upgrade HLX to Overweight from Equal Weight with a $10 price target, showing faith in HLX’s ability to achieve the firm's medium- and longer-term growth expectations for 2018 and beyond.
    • The firm says HLX present a challenging near- and medium-term robotics outlook, but believes the company is on-track to incorporate both of the Siem vessels and Grand Canyon III by year-end 2017, and bring the Q7000 into the fold in 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • ERIC

    Ericsson chosen for key role in Verizon virtualization efforts

    • Verizon Enterprise Solutions has chosen Ericsson (ERIC +3.9%) to support its Managed Network Services platform, boosting ties between the two on network virtualization.
    • Verizon says its updated platform will include software-defined wide area networking (SD-WAN), in a bid to broaden customer self-control in enterprise services.
    • The carrier had launched its broader virtualization initiative in early 2015 with plans to establish a software-defined networking platform.
    • Ericsson's Cloud Manager and Order Care are part of the solution, and it's also providing other services including closed-loop service assurance, VNF testing, and consulting and system integration services.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • M

    Analysts size up Macy's

    • Cowen & Co, analyst Oliver Chen takes the long view on Macy's (M +0.3%) after digesting the Q4 report and strategy update.
    • "Our view is that bigger picture strategic questions remain critical – including a possible form on a M&A or uniquely structured transaction, as M faces long-term pressure from the rise of off-price and Amazon, mall traffic declines particularly in lower productivity malls, and the supply chain revolution underway, and accelerated customer demand for speed," writes Chen.
    • Chen has a one-year price target on Mac's of $44.
    • Stifel Nicolaus' Richard Jaffe is more conservative.
    • "Our target price is $33 (approximately 10x our 2018 EPS estimate of $3.20). This is in line with the one year average of the out year consensus multiple as we believe the current share price reflects improved productivity from store closures," says the analyst.
    • Previously: Macy's beats by $0.06, misses on revenue (Feb. 21)
    • Previously: Macy's higher after profit beat (Feb. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 2 Comments

  • HPT

    Hotel REITs gain on M&A animal spirits

    • It's a strong day for REITs in general, but the lodging names are outperforming after Ashford Hospitality's hostile all-stock offer for FelCor Lodging Trust, which came in at a 28% premium to last week's close.
    • Hospitality Properties (HPT +1.4%), Sunstone Hotel (SHO +0.7%), Pebblebrook Hotel (PEB +1.6%), Chesapeake Lodging (CHSP +1.2%), Summit Hotel (INN +2.1%), RLJ Lodging (RLJ +1.4%), Chatham Lodging (CLDT +1.4%), Host Hotels (HST +1%), Hersha Hospitality (HT +1.6%), DiamondRock Hospitality (DRH +1.9%), Xenia Hotels (XHR +1.3%), Ryman Hospitality (RHP +2.2%)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • WMT

    Price targets on Wal-Mart imply more upside

    • Analysts are largely positive on Wal-Mart's (WMT +3.1%) Q4 earnings report and guidance update.
    • The general sense is that the company's e-commerce business is gaining momentum and that it's riding out the broad pressures on the retail sector despite the immense scale of the Wal-Mart business.
    • Firms such as Robert Baird ($80 PT), MKM Partners ($72 PT), Morgan Stanley ($72 PT), Cowen ($83 PT) and Sanford Bernstein ($75 PT) think shares can still run higher.
    • Previously: Wal-Mart beats by $0.01, misses on revenue (Feb. 21)
    • Previously: E-commerce sales impress at Wal-Mart (Feb. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 4 Comments
  • AMPH

    FDA rejects Amphastar's NDA for intranasal naloxone; shares down 20%

    • Amphastar Pharmaceuticals (AMPH -20.4%) slumps on more than double normal volume in response to its announcement that it received a Complete Response Letter (CRL) from the FDA regarding its New Drug Application (NDA) seeking approval of Naloxone Hydrochloride 2 mg/0.5 mL Nasal Spray for the emergency treatment of opioid overdose.
    • The CRL cited the need for a human factors study, device evaluation and other items before the application can be approved.
    • The company will continue to offer naloxone in pre-filled syringes.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 3 Comments
  • FUN

    Cedar Fair tracks to new high

    • Cedar Fair (FUN +1.4%) pushes higher to carve out a new all-time high of $67.67.
    • Despite the 20% 52-week run for the theme park stock, shares still yield 5.08% for new buyers.
    • Wall Street firms still see room for Cedar Fair to run, with Wedbush ($72 PT), JAnney Montgomery Scott ($76 PT) and FBR & Co ($74 PT) all refreshing their targets last month.
    • On Seeking Alpha, Crunching Numbers has been pointing investors toward Cedar Fair for a over a year.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 4 Comments
  • RILY

    B. Riley Financial acquires FBR & Co.

    • B. Riley Financial (NASDAQ:RILY) -9.0% acquires FBR & Co. (NASDAQ:FBRC) +12% for $160.1M or $20.28/share.
    • Each FBR shareholders will receive .671 shares of B. Riley common stock and an anticipated pre-closing cash dividend of $8.50 per share, assuming funds are available for distribution.
    • Richard Hendrix, FBR's current Chairman and CEO on closing will assume the role of CEO of the combined investment banking and brokerage business, which will be a subsidiary of B. Riley Financial.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 3 Comments
  • ENT

    Global Eagle -29% as CEO, CFO exit posts

    • Global Eagle Entertainment (ENT -29.4%) shares have tanked today on news that its chief executive officer and chief financial officer have resigned, it's guiding to the low end for the full year, and that the company will need extra time to file its 10-K.
    • CEO Dave Davis resigned that post and his board seat in order to pursue other endeavors, the company says. He'll be replaced effective immediately by Jeff Leddy, who's been on the board since January 2013.
    • CFO Tom Severson has resigned as well, and the board says it's initiated a search for new candidates. New CEO Leddy will serve as interim CFO in the meantime.
    • Leddy most recently served as founder and CEO of Verizon Telematics.
    • The company plans to file its 10-K after a March 16 deadline, due to complexity around its acquisition of Emerging Markets, the CFO transition, and "procedures associated with the Company’s material weaknesses in internal control over its financial reporting."
    • It's forecasting full-year revenue near the low end of its previous range of $530M-$538M, vs. consensus for $532.4M.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 3 Comments

  • CRK

    Comstock Resources set to "go terminal," Friendly Bear says

    • Comstock Resources (CRK +5.6%) shakes off a negative report from Friendly Bear on Seeking Alpha that says the company "will go terminal, resulting in a total or near-total wipeout for existing shareholders."
    • The report accuses management of trying to force conversion of preferred shares in order to maintain control and access to lavish perks; "investors deserve to know that management owns the preferred and has been selling/borrowing against the stock, creating huge misalignment issues," according to the report.
    • While CRK teetered on the brink of bankruptcy, Friendly Bear writes that the company's Gulfsteam-IV jet made weekend trips to Vegas, the Bahamas and locations adjacent to Ole Miss games (the CFO’s alma mater).
    • Shares may be getting a boost from a Friday disclosure that Carl Westcott had raised his active stake in the company to 8.67% from 7.13% revealed just 10 days earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 18 Comments
  • CSX

    CSX to cut 22% of management jobs

    • Bloomberg reports that CSX Corp (CSX +0.6%) will eliminate 1,000 management jobs, with the majority coming out of the company's HQ in Jacksonville.
    • The cuts, which represent about 22% of total management positions, are expected to be enacted by the end of March. A voluntary separation program is also on the way from CSX.
    • CSX trades close to its 52-week high of $49.13.
    • Previously: CSX shakes up management (Feb. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 31 Comments
  • MNTA

    FDA OK of Momenta's 40mg Glatopa delayed due to compliance issues at manufacturing site; shares down 15%

    • Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA -15.3%) is under additional pressure today due to its announcement that the FDA approval of a larger dose (40 mg) of Glatopa (glatiramer acetate injection), a generic form of Teva's (TEVA +3.8%) top-selling MS drug Copaxone, probably will not happen this quarter as originally expected. The delay is due to violations at a Pfizer (PFE) manufacturing site that makes the product for distributor Sandoz. The facility recently received a Warning Letter from the FDA that needs to be addressed before the ANDA will be approved.
    • The development is good news for Teva since the bulk of its business is the 40 mg dose (3x/week).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 5 Comments

    • Losers: RTK -44%. CDTX -38%. TRVN -35%. ENT -29%. DRYS -24%. NAK -22%. AMPH -19%. MYOS -18%. MNTA -15%.

    • Gainers: NVFY +25%. CXDC +11%. BORN +10%. SPAR +9%. WKHS +8%.
    • Losers: LBIX-OLD -15%. EFOI -12%. SGOC -9%. UN -8%. UL -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • DCTH

    Retrospective study shows treatment benefit of PHP in metastatic ocular melanoma patients; Delcath up 46%

    • Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH +45.6%) rallies on almost a 9x surge in volume in response to a retrospective analysis of 49 ocular melanoma patients treated during an eight-year period at two cancer centers that showed a treatment effect in those whose cancer had metastasized in the liver and underwent percutaneous hepatic perfusion (PHP) using Melphalan/HDS. The results were presented at the Regional Cancer Therapies 12th International Symposium in Snowbird, UT.
    • The data showed 45.7% of the above patients experienced a partial or complete response. The study also showed that overall survival of responders was projected to be more than three years. A total of 115 PHP treatments were administered (median = 2).
    • Delcath's PHP therapy delivers a high dose of melphalan, a chemotherapeutic agent, directly to the liver via a catheter over a period of 30 minutes.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 11 Comments
  • RTK

    Rentech idles Wawa plant, explores strategic alternatives

    • Rentech (RTK -44.4%) plunges on news it will idle its Wawa facility due to equipment and operational issues that would require additional unbudgeted capital investment.
    • RTK says it is also exploring strategic alternatives for the company as a whole, including a potential sale of the company, a business combination, a sale of all or part of its assets or a recapitalization.
    • RTK also is cutting production at its Atikokan facility to levels needed to fulfill delivery requirements under the Ontario Power Generation offtake contract.
    • RTK expects to incur a significant asset impairment charge relating to the Wawa and Atikokan facilities in its Q4 results.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 11 Comments
  • FNMA

    Frannie now down nearly 40% following court decision

    • It's looking like it could be game over for the common shareholders of Fannie Mae (OTCQB:FNMA -37.9%) and Freddie Mac (OTCQB:FMCC -36.8%) after a federal appeals court affirmed Treasury's net worth sweep.
    • Bulls will now look to new Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin for salvation.
    • Complete ruling here
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 147 Comments
  • JELD

    Analysts start covering Jeld-Wen Holding

    • Analyst coverage pours in on Jeld-Wen Holding (NYSE:JELD) following last month's IPO debut for the company.
    • Wells Fargo initiates coverage at Outperform.
    • JPMorgan starts off Jeld-Wen at Netural, with a price target of $32.
    • RBC lines up Jeld-Wen at Neutral, with a $35 PT.
    • Baird gives Jeld-Wen an Outperform rating and $35 PT.
    • Jeld-Wen is up 30% from the $23 IPO pricing mark.

  • APOP

    Early-stage study validates Cellect Bio's method of stem cell selection; shares ahead 19%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Cellect Biotechnology Ltd. (APOP +19.4%) jumps on more than a 4x surge in volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a Phase 1 study aimed at validating its proprietary method of stem cell selection called ApoGraft. The process allows for the natural enrichment of stem cells that can be used in cell therapies or transplantation with significantly less risk of rejection.
    • The study was conducted on blood stem cells donated by 104 healthy subjects. Each sample represented a 5% graft. ApoGraft, used for only a few hours, produced a significant increase in the death of mature immune cells without compromising the quality and quantity of stem cells.
    • The Company’s technology is expected to provide pharma companies, medical research centers and hospitals with the tools to rapidly isolate stem cells for in quantity and quality that will allow stems cell-related treatments and procedures. Cellect’s technology is applicable to a wide variety of stem cells related treatments in regenerative medicine and that current clinical trials are aimed at the cancer treatment of bone marrow transplantations.

  • VBLT

    VBL's lead product candidate successful in mid-stage thyroid cancer study; shares ahead 4%

    • Thinly traded micro cap VBL Therapeutics (VBLT +3.6%) perks up on average volume in response to its announcement of complete results from a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing lead product candidate VB-111 (ofranergene obadenovec) in patients with advanced, differentiated thyroid cancer. The data are being presented today at the Federation of the Israel Societies for Experimental Biology conference in Eilat.
    • The study met its primary endpoint, at least 25% progression-free survival at month 6 (PFS-6), with a dose response. 47% (n=8/17) of patients in the therapeutic cohort achieved PFS-6 compared to 25% (n=4/12) in the sub-therapeutic cohort. The overall survival benefit (more than 40% at 3.7 years for the therapeutic cohort) was similar to Novartis' (NVS -0.6%) Votrient (pazopanib).
    • VB-111 is an intravenously-administered next-generation anti-angiogenic agent that utilizes the company's Vascular Targeting System to target endothelial cells in the tumor vasculature.

  • VALE

    Vale to seek single class of stock in major governance move

    • Vale (VALE +4.6%) opens at a 52-week high before easing back, after the miner yesterday unveiled a proposal to become a company with no defined controlling shareholders; the news sparked Brazil's benchmark Bovespa stock index to rise yesterday to near six-year highs.
    • The proposal seeks to unify Vale’s two existing classes of stock so that all of its shares carry voting rights, up from ~61% now; controlling shareholder Valepar, which currently holds 53.9% of Vale’s voting stock and is majority-owned by state-run entities, would lose its control of Vale.
    • Analysts say the proposal should improve transparency, reduce the potential for government interference, and make Vale easier to compare to its peers.

  • TRVN

    Trevena reports positive late-stage results for opioid substitute oliceridine; safety/side effect data underwhelm; shares slump 32% premarket

    • Trevena (NASDAQ:TRVN) plummets 32% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement to positive top-line data from two Phase 3 studies, APOLLO-1 and APOLLO-2, assessing lead product candidate oliceridine for the treatment of moderate-to-severe acute pain following bunionectomy and abdominoplasty procedures.
    • Investors are apparently heading for exits over less-than-expected safety and side effect data compared to morphine. The company refers to the data as "showing dose-related trends" although it states that the results as statistically significant (p<0.05).
    • Oliceridine, a G-protein-biased ligand that targets the mu opioid receptor, is being developed as a potential replacement of intravenous opioid analgesics. Its value proposition is comparable pain relieving efficacy to morphine while minimizing the unwanted respiratory depression, GI dysfunction (constipation), nausea and vomiting.
